trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SEQ_00<tab>Never one to stand still, Wuk Lamat is ready to race back to Alexandria.

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SEQ_01<tab>No sooner do you broach the subject of returning to the dome with Wuk Lamat than does Erenville inquire into the details of your business there. As it happens, he too is considering a sojourn to Alexandria, that he might find a way to aid those affected by the turmoil. Thus do you set off for the Backroom together─with his charming Cahciua curio in tow.

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SEQ_02<tab>You arrive at the perfect time to hear the fruits of Shale's labors: a series of audio diaries recorded by Teeshal Ja herself, detailing her feelings for Zoraal Ja and his rejection of their child. Though these disturbing revelations would be overwhelming even for an adult, Gulool Ja puts on a brave face, and even thanks present company for helping him to learn the truth of his birth at long last.

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SEQ_03<tab>With Gulool Ja's questions answered, Shale may now commit to other matters, such as Y'shtola's investigative foray into Living Memory. The pair depart with little fanfare, leaving you and your remaining companions to your own devices.

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SEQ_04<tab>As your primary concern outside of Gulool Ja is spreading word of the railroad's resumption of service, you speak with Geode, who in turn surprises you with the news that precious few people intend to make the journey to Tuliyollal. Given how many voiced their desire to do so before, this is an odd shift in sentiment indeed, and you and Wuk Lamat resolve to learn what prompted it.

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SEQ_05<tab>As you approach a crowd gathered near the site of Sphene's funeral, it is clear from their discourse that they have not only failed to come to terms with their existential turmoil in your absence, but have worked themselves into an ever greater panic over their mortality. Glad are they, then, when their beloved Queen Sphene suddenly appears with a solution: to convert the people into Endless via neo regulators, that they need fear death no longer. Given that you were instrumental in the destruction of the Queen of Reason, you and Wuk Lamat immediately suspect deception, and your doubt only grows when “Sphene” mentions the caveat that, at present, her proposed boon will only be extended to five thousand citizens. Despite Wuk Lamat's protestations, none join you in your skepticism, for the Alexandrians seem to be afflicted with collective amnesia and have no recollection of her death or subsequent funeral...

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SEQ_06<tab>As there is naught to be gained from continuing to make a spectacle of yourself in challenging the queen's claims, you rejoin your companions in the Backroom, there to await further intelligence from Oblivion's members in the field. You will need to proceed with caution until such time as you know more about the entity wearing Sphene's face.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_TODO_00<tab>Speak with G'raha Tia in the Backroom.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Y'shtola.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Geode.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat at leynode nine.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Krile.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_001<tab>It won't be as I once envisioned...but perhaps someday we can take that train journey to Yyasulani together.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_010<tab>Well, it's possible that Shale's made some headway by now. And regardless, we should spread word that the railroad's been restored to service.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_011<tab>Shale? What do you have her working on?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_012<tab>Gulool Ja's mother...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_013<tab>I'd feel the same in his shoes. <var 1A 02 /var>Have<var 1A 01 /var> felt the same. Some questions are painful to leave unanswered...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_014<tab>There's no cause to look at me like that. The Cahciua we met may have only been a simulacrum, but her memory was real.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_015<tab>I needn't search for what she left behind, because she left it with me. And I will carry it always...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_016<tab>Speaking of things you're carrying...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_017<tab>Is that a teeny-tiny Cahciua?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_018<tab>What!? No!
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_019<tab>It is merely a token from Alexandria. Our friends in Oblivion would not take no for an answer, and I thought it as good a souvenir as any...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>Whatever you say... For what it's worth, <var 1A 02 /var>I<var 1A 01 /var> think it's a nice way to bring her with you on your travels.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_021<tab>...Yes. Well. You're off to the dome now, aren't you?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_022<tab>I thought I might join you for a time. See if there is aught I can do for the people there. Much changed though it is, I still consider it my home.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_023<tab>Of course! We can give you the full story on the way.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_025<tab>Looks like we arrived at a good time.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GULOOLJA_000_030<tab>Erenville is wearing his Cahciua! That makes me happy.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_035<tab>So Zoraal Ja was conducting secret research in Yuweyawata... I have some memories of the place from my childhood.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_KRILE_000_040<tab>You must be exhausted. Shall I nip out for an energy tonic?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SHALE_000_045<tab>Glad you're back. We wouldn't want to keep Gulool Ja here waiting any longer than necessary.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_050<tab>Seeing Erenville never fails to remind me of Cahciua...and I wouldn't have it any other way.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_051<tab>The dead should be remembered, this I firmly believe. Gulool Ja's mother deserves that too.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GRAHATIA_000_100<tab>...A simple yet elegant solution. And thus is the railroad back in operation.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GRAHATIA_000_101<tab>Meanwhile, Shale has nearly finished processing the data. She will be able to share her findings with us imminently.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_102<tab>...I'm interrupting something, I gather.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_KRILE_000_103<tab>Why, Y'shtola! What brings you here?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_104<tab>I've seen enough of the gate in the Skydeep Cenote for now, so I'm shifting my investigation to Living Memory.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_105<tab>While there, I thought I would do well to have the company of an expert on electrope.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SHALE_000_106<tab>I'd like to take a closer look at the place myself. I can join you once we've finished here.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_107<tab>Lest you fear I've forgotten, once I've made headway with Living Memory, the key in your keeping shall be the next subject of my scrutiny.

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_110<tab>...You may find it hard to believe, but until the rite of succession, Zoraal Ja was a good brother to me. Always. And I thought that Papa was the best father anyone could ask for.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_111<tab>I don't want to think the time we spent together as a family was a lie. But by the same token, the bitterness my brother harbored was all too real...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GULOOLJA_000_115<tab>It's okay. I wanted to know more about my parents, and now I do. And I don't regret it.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GULOOLJA_000_116<tab>I have Lamaty'i, and Koana, and you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I'm not lonely now.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_120<tab>No matter how brave a face Gulool Ja puts on, I expect it will take him time to come to terms with this.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_121<tab>He is a strong one, though. You needn't worry too much.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_KRILE_000_125<tab>Why leave such a record, you ask? I cannot be certain, but I believe Teeshal Ja simply wanted someone to know how she felt. To understand.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GRAHATIA_000_130<tab>If the dome had not appeared, Teeshal Ja's tale would have been very different. Yet whether or not she would have been happier, I cannot say.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SHALE_000_135<tab>Teeshal Ja left written records as well. I'll compile them for Gulool Ja. Perhaps something in them will be of comfort.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_140<tab>What a mess...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_200<tab>"It's better to know“... A profound response, for one so young.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SHALE_100_200<tab>Though I wish he didn't have to be, Gulool Ja is indeed wise beyond his years.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_201<tab>Yet one never outgrows the need for dependable companions. 'Tis fortunate that he has you.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GULOOLJA_100_201<tab>Thank you, Shale. Because of you, I got to hear my mother's whole story.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SHALE_200_201<tab>You heard it because you were brave enough to listen, Gulool Ja. If you remember one thing, remember that.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_SHALE_000_202<tab>Now then─having shared what I can at present, I am ready to head to Living Memory when you are.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_203<tab>I am planning to be thorough, so we will need to stop for supplies on the way.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_000_204<tab>That said, I promise we won't remain overlong. I know we all have much and more to attend to.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_YSHTOLA_100_204<tab>For now, farewell.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_205<tab>With the railroad ready, I'd like to get some idea of how many returnees we can expect before heading back to Tuliyollal.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GULOOLJA_000_210<tab>Is Shale going to be alright out there? The whole time she was working on the data, I never saw her take a break...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_215<tab>I'll stick around for a while. Let me know if you need me.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_KRILE_000_220<tab>One wouldn't know it to look at them, but Shale and Y'shtola are birds of a feather. An incorrigibly restless feather...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GRAHATIA_000_225<tab>The twins have yet to return. I hope everything is all right.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_300<tab>A word, before you leave.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_301<tab>Our network's already spreading word of the railroad. We expected people would be clamoring to get on the first train back...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_302<tab>Yet the reaction's been the polar opposite. Scant few seem inclined to depart Alexandria any time soon.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_303<tab>What? When we spoke before, you said many from Tuliyollal were eager to reunite with friends and family.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_304<tab>Maybe they're concerned about getting through Vanguard? If so, we could take turns accompanying them...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_305<tab>In any case, we need to speak with the people ourselves. Let's start at leynode nine.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GULOOLJA_000_310<tab>Now that the railroad's working again, it'll be much easier to visit Tuliyollal. It would be nice to see Koana again as well.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_315<tab>I've asked Geode to fill me in on all that has happened in the dome of late. If I hear anything of interest, I'll be sure to pass it on.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_KRILE_000_320<tab>The people were so nervous about remaining in Alexandria... I cannot help but wonder what prompted this sudden change of heart.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GRAHATIA_000_325<tab>Perhaps we will venture out for a bit ourselves.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_330<tab>I'm as surprised as you are. Everyone was keen to pack their bags before, but now that the journey's possible, they can't be bothered?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_100_400<tab>There may still be people gathering in Praxis Park. Let's try there first.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_400<tab>Seriously, what was that!?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GULOOLJA_000_405<tab>Queen Sphene has returned? How?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ERENVILLE_000_410<tab>Sphene was erased. If she's back, then are the Endless...?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ALPHINAUD_000_415<tab>We've heard about the Queen of Reason's proclamation. The rumors spread through the district like wildfire.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ALISAIE_000_420<tab>You saw Sphene with your own eyes, then? So it wasn't someone else...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GRAHATIA_000_425<tab>Without the Meso Terminal, how does she propose to create new Endless? We must contact Y'shtola as soon as possible.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GEODE_000_430<tab>There's naught to report yet, but we have all eyes and ears out in Everkeep and Heritage Found.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_KRILE_000_500<tab>We only caught the proclamation from a distance, but I can tell you that the message about neo regulators was received with utmost clarity.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ALISAIE_000_501<tab>It couldn't have been Sphene. She should've been destroyed when the Meso Terminal shut down...

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ALPHINAUD_000_503<tab>...Without a single Alexandrian to bear witness. Presented with an identical figure claiming to be their beloved queen, 'tis no surprise that they would choose to believe she's alive.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_ALPHINAUD_000_504<tab>What is troubling, however, is their denial that the funeral was held in her honor. 'Tis as if their memories have been erased...
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_GRAHATIA_000_505<tab>Given that the members of Oblivion remain unaffected, that was likely the work of the regulators. But by whose design?
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_506<tab>Someone smart enough to play at being the Queen of Reason. In that guise, even if some suspect deception, most of Alexandria will be on her side.
TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_WUKLAMAT_000_507<tab>We need to find out who she <var 1A 02 /var>really<var 1A 01 /var> is.

TEXT_KINGMG107_05250_KRILE_000_508<tab>While I agree wholeheartedly, we should avoid drawing more attention than we already have. We must be patient until Oblivion's network turns up a lead...or until our self-proclaimed queen makes her next move.
